Name: Backup and Recovery
Description: Backup and recovery entails keeping copies of configuration and data, as needed, to allow for the quick restoration of service in the event of malicious incidents, system failures, or corruption.

Name: Central Log Management with Analysis
Description: Central log management with analysis is the collection, storage, and analysis of telemetry, where the collection and storage are designed to facilitate data fusion and where the security analysis aids in discovery and response to malicious activity.

Name: Configuration Management
Description: Configuration management is the implementation of a formal plan for documenting and managing changes to the environment, and monitoring for deviations, preferably automated.

Name: Incident Response Planning and Incident Handling
Description: Incident response planning and incident handling is the documentation and implementation of a set of instructions, procedures, or technical capabilities to sense and detect, respond to, limit consequences of malicious cyberattacks, and restore the integrity of the network and associated systems.
Controls: ID.GV, ID.RA, PR.IP, DE.DP, DE.AE, RS.RP, RS.CO, RS.AN, RS.MI

Name: Inventory
Description: Inventory entails developing, documenting, and maintaining a current inventory of all systems, networks, and components so that only authorized devices are given access, and unauthorized and unmanaged devices are found and restricted from gaining access.

Name: Least Privilege
Description: Least privilege is a design principle whereby each entity is granted the minimum system resources and authorizations that the entity needs to perform its function.

Name: Secure Administration
Description: Secure administration entails securely performing administrative tasks, using secure protocols.

Name: Strong Authentication
Description: Strong authentication verifies the identity of users, devices, or other entities through rigorous means (e.g., multi-factor authentication) before granting access.

Name: Time Synchronization
Description: Time synchronization is the coordination of system (e.g., servers, workstations, network devices) clocks to minimize the difference between system clock times and enable accurate comparison of timestamps between systems.

Name: Vulnerability Management
Description: Vulnerability management is the practice of proactively working to discover vulnerabilities by including the use of both active and passive means of discovery and by taking action to mitigate discovered vulnerabilities.

Name: Patch Management
Description: Patch management is the identification, acquisition, installation, and verification of patches for products and systems.

Name: Auditing and Accounting
Description: Auditing and accounting includes capturing business records (e.g., logs and other telemetry), making them available for auditing and accounting as required, and designing an auditing system that considers insider threat (e.g., separation of duties violation tracking) such that insider abuse or misuse can be detected.

Name: Resilience
Description: Resilience entails ensuring that systems, services, and protections maintain acceptable performance under adverse conditions.

Name: Enterprise Threat Intelligence
Description: Enterprise threat intelligence is the usage of threat intelligence from private or government sources to implement mitigations for the identified risks.

Name: Situational Awareness
Description: Situational awareness is maintaining effective current and historical awareness across all components.
Controls: ID.AM, ID.RA, PR.DS, PR.IP, DE.AE, DE.CM, DE.DP, RS.CO

Name: Dynamic Threat Discovery
Description: Dynamic threat discovery is the practice of using dynamic approaches (e.g., heuristics, baselining, etc.) to discover new malicious activity.

Name: Policy Enforcement Parity
Description: Policy enforcement parity entails consistently applying security protections and other policies, independent of the communication mechanism, forwarding path, or endpoints used.

Name: Effective Use of Shared Services
Description: Effective use of shared services means that shared services are employed, where applicable, and individually tailored and measured to independently validate service conformance, and offer effective protections for tenants against malicious actors, both external and internal to the service provider.
Controls: ID.AM, ID.GV, ID.RM, ID.SC, PR.AT, RS.CO

Name: Integrated Desktop, Mobile, and Remote Policies
Description: Integrated desktop, mobile, and remote policies define and enforce policies that apply to a given agency entity independent of its location.

Name: Anti-malware
Description: Anti-malware protections detect the presence of malicious code and facilitate its quarantine or removal.

Name: Content Disarm and Reconstruction
Description: Content disarm and reconstruction technology detects the presence of unapproved active content and facilitates its removal.

Name: Detonation Chamber
Description: Detonation chambers facilitate the detection of malicious code using protected and isolated execution environments to analyze the files.

Name: Data Loss Prevention
Description: Data loss prevention (DLP) technologies detect instances of the exfiltration, either malicious or accidental, of agency data.

Name: Anti-phishing Protections
Description: Anti-phishing protections detect instances of phishing and prevent users from accessing them.

Name: Anti-spam Protections
Description: Anti-spam protections detect and quarantine instances of spam.

Name: Authenticated Received Chain
Description: Authenticated received chain allows for an intermediary, like a mailing list or forwarding service, to sign its own authentication of the original email, allowing downstream entities to accept the intermediary’s authentication even if the email was changed.

Name: Data Loss Prevention
Description: DLP technologies detect instances of the exfiltration, either malicious or accidental, of agency data.

Name: Domain Signature Verification for Incoming Email
Description: Domain signature verification protections authenticate incoming email according to the Domain-based Message Authentication Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) email authentication protocol defined in Request for Comments (RFC) 7489.5

Name: Domain Signatures for Outgoing Email
Description: Domain signature protections facilitate the authentication of outgoing emails by signing the emails and ensuring that external parties may validate the email signatures according to the DMARC email authentication protocol that is defined in RFC 7489.

Name: Encryption for Email Transmission
Description: Email services are configured to use encrypted connections, when possible, for communications between clients and other email servers.

Name: Malicious Link Protections
Description: Malicious link protections detect malicious links in emails and prevent users from accessing them.

Name: Link Click-through Protection
Description: Link click-through protections ensure that when a link from an email is clicked, the requester is directed to a protection that verifies the security of the link destination before permitting access.

Name: EINSTEIN 3 Accelerated Email Protections
Description: EINSTEIN 3 Accelerated (E3A)6 is an intrusion prevention capability offered by NCPS, provided by CISA, that includes an email filtering security service.

Name: Break and Inspect
Description: Break and Inspect systems, or encryption proxies, terminate encrypted traffic, log or perform policy enforcement against the plaintext, and re-encrypt the traffic, if applicable, before transmitting to the final destination.

Name: Active Content Mitigation
Description: Active content mitigation protections detect the presence of unapproved active content and facilitate its removal.

Name: Certificate Denylisting
Description: Certificate denylisting protections prevent communication with entities that use a set of known bad certificates.

Name: Content Filtering
Description: Content filtering protections detect the presence of unapproved content and facilitate its removal or denial of access.

Name: Authenticated Proxy
Description: Authenticated proxies require entities to authenticate with the proxy before making use of it, enabling user, group, and location-aware security controls.

Name: Data Loss Prevention
Description: DLP technologies detect instances of the exfiltration, either malicious or accidental, of agency data.

Name: Domain Resolution Filtering
Description: Domain resolution filtering prevents entities from using the DNS-over-Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS), or DoH, domain resolution protocol, possibly evading DNS-based protections.

Name: Protocol Compliance Enforcement
Description: Protocol compliance enforcement technologies ensure that traffic complies with protocol definitions, like those documented by the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF).7

Name: Domain Category Filtering
Description: Domain category filtering technologies allow for classes of domains (e.g., banking, medical) to receive a different set of security protections.

Name: Domain Reputation Filtering
Description: Domain reputation filtering protections are a form of domain denylisting based on a domain’s reputation, as defined by either the agency or an external entity.

Name: Bandwidth Control
Description: Bandwidth control technologies allow for limiting the amount of bandwidth used by different classes of domains.

Name: Malicious Content Filtering
Description: Malicious content filtering protections detect the presence of malicious content and facilitate its removal.

Name: Access Control
Description: Access control technologies allow an agency to define policies that limit what actions may be performed by connected users and entities.

Name: Access Control
Description: Access control protections prevent the ingress, egress, or transmission of unauthorized network traffic.

Name: Internet Address Denylisting
Description: Internet address denylisting protections prevent the ingest or transiting of traffic received from, or destined, to a denylisted internet address.

Name: Host Containment
Description: Host containment protections enable a network to revoke or quarantine a host’s access to the network.

Name: Network Segmentation
Description: Network segmentation separates a given network into subnetworks, facilitating security controls between the subnetworks, and decreasing the attack surface of the network.

Name: Microsegmentation
Description: Microsegmentation divides the network, either physically or virtually, according to the communication needs of application and data workflows, facilitating security controls to protect the data.

Name: Distributed Denial of Service Protections
Description: Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) protections mitigate the effects of distributed denial of service attacks.

Name: Elastic Expansion
Description: Elastic expansion enables agencies to dynamically expand the resources available for services as conditions require.

Name: Regional Delivery
Description: Regional delivery technologies enable the deployment of agency services across geographically diverse locations.

Name: Shadow Information Technology Detection
